remarks: Another way to write the loop space base in terms of the base of the fundamental group.  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 10-Jul-2015.)
statement:
pi1val.g $e |- G = ( J pi1 Y ) $.
pi1val.1 $e |- ( ph -> J e. ( TopOn ` X ) ) $.
pi1val.2 $e |- ( ph -> Y e. X ) $.
pi1val.o $e |- O = ( J Om1 Y ) $.
pi1bas.b $e |- ( ph -> B = ( Base ` G ) ) $.
pi1bas.k $e |- ( ph -> K = ( Base ` O ) ) $.
pi1buni $p |- ( ph -> U. B = K ) $.
